content.description:
Dr. Xiang examined a 21-year-old patient who had fallen and hit their head. After a brain scan was conducted, Dr. Xiang discovered that the patient was missing their cerebellum. Dr. Xiang extensively interviewed the patient and their family and learned that the patient had a long history of balance and coordination problems. 
Based on this patient, Dr. Xiang tells her colleague that anyone who is missing their cerebellum will always experience balance and coordination problems.
content.question: Which of the following responses from Dr. Xiang’s colleague would be the most appropriate?

choices.label: Dr. Xiang cannot generalize her findings to the larger population because she used a single case study.
Dr. Xiang cannot make causal inferences because she conducted a naturalistic observation.
Dr. Xiang can generalize her findings to the larger population because she had a representative sample.
Dr. Xiang can make causal inferences because she conducted a longitudinal study.

content.answer: Dr. Xiang cannot generalize her findings to the larger population because she used a single case study.

skill.text: 2.C: Evaluate the appropriate use of research design elements in non-experimental methodologies.
